headline: Great place to work and, specially, learn

headline: Used to be fantastic. Going downhill since mid '18
Great place to work
pros:
- Challenges are exciting
- Trust in the team and support from Governance
- Remote work
- Mobility markets are booming in all cities, in Cabify you have the opportunity to make an impact.
cons:
- Lack of ownership but we've been working this out for the last two years so by the time you read it its probably solved.
- If you're an english or portuguese speaker know that the official global meetings are in spanish. However the company makes an effort to translate in realtime and also to send all other communications in above mentioned three languages.

headline: Going down
pros: Good environment and think out of the box
cons: Leadership is  a problem  currently

headline: Run away!!
pros: Flexibility: flexible schedule & work from home
cons: Too many to write them down. No learning, I even feel I have "unlearnt" everything I knew before starting. No carreer growth unless you are personal friend from top management. Head and top management positions filled in by useless people because of that. Feels like you are in high school due to this political war. They reestructured and everything they have gained is that employees have lost their exitement and willingness to work there. Massive turnover (70% of the people I was working with quit voluntarily). They will always find a way not to pay you your bonuses, besides the fact you are being given your KPIs one week before the month ends up.

headline: The job that gave me patience
pros: It teaches you how to be patient. It teaches you how to deal with incompetent people. Your work impacts the real world, the company is big and you can learn a lot. There are very interesting people, especially in Product.
cons:
The company has grown very fast and it has caused many gaps that have been filled with hurry and without attention; every internal process is outdated, which is very surprising and frustrating, since you're there to work in a startup environment; and there is a lot of bureaucracy that results in even more frustration for the employees. 

There are many management positions occupied by 'friends of' who are obviously incompetent but the system they have created makes it impossible to point them out. They are all friends with each other and defend each other when necessary. They have created a pyramid of people who do not know how to do their job but who can't be fired, it looks like a big joke. It reminds me of 'House of Cards'.

headline: Awesome team, challenges and impact.
pros:
On of the few, fast growing tech unicorns in Europe.
Amazing team and product challenges.
Remote friendly.
cons: Compensation is getting a lot better but it still needs to improve. Good thing is there are multiple active actions in the right direction.

headline: Good environment with some internal issues
pros: Great environment, it's like a big family where everyone is really trying for the company to grow. You will love it there!
cons: The exponential growth it has had over the last 2 years haven't been so good in terms of internal communication . You will feel there is a lot of chaos and it can be stressful sometimes. The sales department doesn't have much opportunities to grow, and normally it will be the people who has been there the longest the ones to be promoted.

headline: Great company with a lot of potential but, lacks of leadership.

headline: Great company, great values.
pros:
Great culture, very fast-paced working environment, good people.

Can be a great learning opportunity, the company is growing fast but there's a lot to do and you can have a lot of fun while doing it.

Also always thinking what to do next which is exciting.
cons:
Constant changes in projects and management decisions lead to inefficiency at times.  

A lot of responsibility even for junior profiles which is a good opportunity to show that you can be an asset to the company, however it also means a lot of pressure.
